solution_line_template: At the end of 2018, the tree will grow {initial_height} x {growth_percentage} = <<{initial_height}*{growth_percentage}={growth_2018}>>{growth_2018} meters more.
Thus, its height at the end of 2018 is {initial_height} + {growth_2018} = <<{initial_height}+{growth_2018}={height_end_2018}>>{height_end_2018} meters.
At the end of 2019, the tree will grow {height_end_2018} x {growth_percentage} = <<{height_end_2018}*{growth_percentage}={growth_2019}>>{growth_2019} meters more.
So, its height at the end of 2019 is {height_end_2018} + {growth_2019} = <<{height_end_2018}+{growth_2019}={height_end_2019}>>{height_end_2019} meters.
Therefore, the tree has grown {height_end_2019} - {initial_height} = <<{height_end_2019}-{initial_height}={total_growth}>>{total_growth} meters.
